intro: Azalea mariae, commonly known as the Marie azalea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is part of the Ericaceae family. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of pink, red, and white. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Azalea mariae is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
